title: What Lurks Below - Sebarus's Author Page
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:black-highlighter-theme]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:pride-highlighter |inc-ace= --]]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:bhl-dark-sidebar]]
[[include :topia:cqb:flow speed=1]]
[[module CSS]]
}

#page-content > .collapsible-block .collapsible-block-content {
    text-align: left;
}

.addendum {
    border:solid 2px #999999;
    background:#F5F5F5;
    width:84%;
    padding:1px 15px;
    margin: 10px auto;
}
[[/module]]

[[=]]
+ [[size 200%]][[span style="color:black"]]W̵͔̟̃̆̆̽ͅͅę̸̮̣̗̌̇̆͌l̵̛͔̱͙͖̈́͝c̶̘̖͈̓o̷̙̙͗̓͝m̷̠̤͎̔ͅe̷̩̜̫̽̃̕,̵̻͚͍̺͂̊͠ ̶̢̓͊̇t̶͓͌͝r̶̗̀̈́̌ͅa̵̺̗̳̔v̵̯̰̱͒̓̀ȩ̶͈̠̏̈́l̶̺͈̏̆̐̑e̸͎͊͑̽̕r̷̝͛͑͝[[/span]][[/size]]
[[/=]]
[[=]]
//*Ahem*//
[[/=]]
As I was saying, welcome, traveler. Haven't seen a lot of souls ever since they locked me down here. Why not stay a while, and listen to an old thing ramble? You don't look like you're in a hurry either, not with that leg of yours. Be careful around the edge, so you don't fall in here. It's a long way down.

Oh, why am I down here, you ask. I'm here because many choose to fear that which they don't understand, and many choose to destroy, or in my case lock away, what they fear. I have been here for a long time, so long that most souls in this facility have forgotten that I'm even here. I have had a lot of free time. Want to know what I do with that free time?

I write. With will as my quill and the fabric of reality as my canvas, I write, and my words shape reality.

[[module ListUsers users="."]]
Who's to say I'm not writing about you right now, %%title%%? Are the movements of your eyes, scanning the screen in front of you, merely dictations of mine?
[[/module]]

What? Sorry, I was just talking to another friend of mine. Do you want to see what other lives my words have molded?

------

[[tabview]]
[[tab SCPs]]
[[<]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[scp-4823 |SCP-4823 - The Whole World Has Gone Bananas!]]]
"//The main anomaly of SCP-4823 is a localized trans-dimensional two-way gateway in place of fruit flesh. The gateway becomes exposed when the banana is peeled, which can only be done halfway. Upon exposure, the gateway will draw the peeler in, exposing them to a noodle effect caused by a strong non-homogenous gravitational field, in order for them to fit through.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This was my first skip, and it has exceeded all my wildest dreams. A bit of context: while I only became a member of the site in 2018 and active in the community in 2019, I have been an active lurker here since 2012-2013. I enjoyed reading the site, but the community always seemed distant to me somehow. The fact that I'm now part of it feels... weird, and the fact that I have produced content for it even weirder. When I made this, I was proud of just getting something on the site. I expected this to reach maybe +20, and I would have been happy with that. But, against all of my expectations, it got into the Reviewer's Spotlight (thank you [[*user Kilonova]]) and the rating just soared. After that, people have made fan art and audio adaptations and translations of it, it's appeared (briefly) in a Markiplier video and it's just... mind blowing to me. On the September of 2020 it also became the first article on the site to have ever been both Reviewer's spotlighted //and// featured (thank you [[*user OCuin]], [[*user Flopmind]] and [[*user REDESERT]]), which is even more insane. 

Oh, a few fun facts: This was actually inspired by a dumb JoJo meme posted in the WL Discord by [[*user Rounderhouse]], and every character in this skip is actually named after different banana varieties.
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/<]]

[[<]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[scp-5535 |SCP-5535 - When Even Your Hand Hates You]]]
"//SCP-5535 was arrested for the murder of its wife and the attempted murder of its child in 13/07/2016. The subject claimed that it had lost control over its left hand, which had then choked its wife to death against its will.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
I don't have a lot to say about this. I made it in one day, after getting the idea from wiggling my fingers in the bathroom mirror.
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/<]]

[[<]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]
+++ [[[scp-5063 |SCP-5063 - Driving The Turtles To Market]]]
//"You're here because you found out that the can is magic. I figured that in a world with things like the can and people like the person who made it, there must be someone responsible for keeping it out of the public eye. Am I correct?"//
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This was my [[[http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/exquisite-corpse-contest |CorpseCon]]] entry, and thus a collab with [[*user stop1010]]. Making it was a bit of a struggle, and went through a lot of research, brainstorming, critique, editing, trimming, etc. At the end of the day though, I'm pretty happy with how it turned out. 

This is basically a critique on the ecological impact of capitalism and its unsustainability, based on an actual culinary trend which lead to the decimation of the snapping turtle population in real life. It was an interesting topic to research and write about, and I'm glad this project made me do that. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/<]]

[[<]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[scp-5137 |SCP-5137 - Friendship Is Only Skin Deep]]]
//"When in close proximity to a living human, SCP-5137 will split down the middle and attempt to envelop the individual. If unobstructed, SCP-5137 will morph in size and coloration until it is indistinguishable from the subject's actual skin. SCP-5137 refer to this behavior as 'hugging'."//
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This was my first real attempt at horror, and it kind of shows. Like with 5063, I tried going for something reminiscent of Series 1 tropes, in this case a murder monster instead of a thing that does a thing, but with a modern twist. Unlike 5063 however, it didn't do very well. It's fine though, I'm happy enough with it, and while being my lowest rated work at the time of writing, it's been steadily going up and it's not gonna fall into deletion anytime soon. Hopefully. 

5137 is also a good example of inspiration coming from the weirdest of places. I have a bad habit of picking on the skin of my fingers, and the thought of "what if you made a construct out of skin" hit me while I was doing that. I have no idea where the friendship aspect of it came from.
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/<]]

[[<]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[scp-5224 |SCP-5224 - Hecking Frogs]]]
//"After manifestation, produced frogs will instantly head towards the nearest site of plant agriculture. Upon arrival, they will begin to consume insect life at a rate that is highly damaging to the ecological balance of the region."//
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
I honestly don't remember how I came up with this. Not one bit. I honestly lowkey expected it to go the negatives and be deleted when I posted because it's sort of an obscure reference and I didn't know if people were gonna find it funny. I said to myself when posting "ehh, let's see what happens. If it flops I'll just make it a WWS format". Surprisingly, it popped off way more than I thought. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/<]]

[[<]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[scp-5834 |SCP-5834 - Tender Sausage Of The Ocean]]]
//"SCP-5834 is a black sea cucumber (Holothuria forskali). People who view SCP-5834 will begin to regard it as their ideal romantic partner."//
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This was my entry for the CupidCon, and it's kind of different from the type of stuff I normally write. It still retains the same level of absurdism, but it's absurd comedy instead of the usual tragedy. Originally, I wanted to write like, proper romance for the contest because that's not something I've written before, but I couldn't come up with any exciting ideas and I was really unmotivated by the contest. Then I came up with this ridiculous idea, and pitched it to a few friends in voicechat, whose disgusted reactions assured me that I had to write it. 

It was originally supposed to be kind of a parody on those weird dating simulators where you're romancing a lama prince or some shit, but then it evolved into... something else. I'm actually pretty proud of how it turned out. 

Few fun facts: Dr. Ducrotay is named after Henri Marie Ducrotay de Blainville, the dude who found and taxonomized sea cucumbers. He did that in 1834, which is why the designation for the article is 5834. 

On the topic of fun facts, if this commentary hasn't convinced you read the article, I'll let you know that I read a lot about sea cucumbers and found out a lot of weird and fun facts about them, that I've sprinkled throughout the article. So if you fee like learning about these weird animals... you get the hint. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/<]]

[[<]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[scp-6537 |SCP-6537 - Butterflies In My Stomach]]]
//"At least I have the moths."//
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This was originally a Bright challenge, but I wasn't happy with the first iteration of it so I deleted it, rewrote it and then reposted it, even though it probably would have survived. I didn't get any critique for the rewrite either, other than the comments on the first post, but I don't know if that disqualifies this as a successful Bright challenge. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/<]]
[[/tab]]
[[tab Tales]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[singed-books-and-broken-worlds |Singed Books And Broken Worlds]]]
"//There was a silent beat, as everything fell quiet and still. Then, chaos broke out. The space was filled with a loud groan and then a loud boom, as the Way violently collapsed, sending a wave of uncontained magical energy rushing forwards.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This was made for the first day of JamCon 2020, when the theme was "EXPLOSIONS". I wrote this in the span of maybe 4 hours in the middle of the night. It was exhausting but I'm pretty proud of how this turned out.
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]

[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[lantern-bearer |Lantern Bearer]]]
"//However, of all the peculiar jobs in The Pillars, the most essential of all is that of the lantern bearers. The light of the lanterns you see, doesn't just provide well-appreciated visibility in the foggy streets of The Pillars, but it also keeps at bay The-Shapes-In-The-Fog.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
The first article featuring a Free Port I'm trying to establish, The Pillars. It was also made for [[[monthly-prompts |Monthly Prompts]]] by [[*user DarkStuff]].
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]

[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[the-blood-that-binds-us |The Blood That Binds Us]]]
"//Chompy in tow, Jeremy walks into the joint living room and kitchen, where a woman in a green dress and a petticoat is busy chopping something. Hearing the boy come in, she turns, revealing her mutilated and fingerless hand and a bloody knife held in the other.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
CotBG saw a shift from always being the bad guys to being more neutral a long time ago, I feel like sarkicists are still mostly seen as the villains, which I'm not a fan of. There's been a few articles about good proto-sarkics, but I don't remember seeing any about neo-sarkics. So, as I've regardless always liked sarkicism, I decided that I would try to write a story about the average life of average practitioners of Nälkä. No cults, no crazy blood rituals, no nefarious secret agenda. Just a normal family with a normal life, who just happen to practice carnomancy and have flesh beast as a pet. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]

[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[the-paintings-burn-a-crimson-red |The Paintings Burn A Crimson Red]]]
"//The crowbar smashes into the balloon-like head of what used to be the hotel bartender, scattering thick, purple sludge across the walls and roof of the abandoned bar.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
The first tale in Spectrum, the tale series that my team, consisting of myself, [[*user BrokenOrdinance]] and [[*user UncertaintyCrossing]], wrote for the Canon Renaissance Contest. It's set in the later stages of the Rat's Nest canon, so everything is weird and reality is fucked up. It tells the tale of Mirage, an angy, delusional bird-man surviving in the apocalypse and embarking on a journey to paint the greatest painting the world has ever seen. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[the-hills-of-adelanto-are-covered-in-a-cinnabar-green |The Hills of Adelanto Are Covered In A Cinnabar Green]]]
"//"That," Mirage says and points, as a flock of floating hot irons emerge from the treeline, their plugs whipping in the air and their metal sizzling aggressively.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
Third tale for the series that me, UncertaintyCrossing and BrokenOrdinance wrote for CanRenCon. This one was a collaboration between myself and Crossing, with me writing the first half and him the latter. We studied Adelanto and its history and tried to include as much as we could about it in the tale. Even the hot irons are there because the founder of the town was the inventor of them. I also just thought that the image of flying hot irons chasing people is cool.
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]

[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[pinpricks |Pinpricks]]]
//"I remember I don't have vocal cords anymore. There's only light in my throat now. I let go off the person who's name used to be something with an A and apologise. My hand feels heavier. Few seconds later I realize that it's in my mouth, and now it feels lighter than before. This works."//
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This was my first real attempt at writing stream of consciousness. It wasn't received super well, which is understandable, it's a bit weird and out of my comfort zone, but I'm proud of it. I think there's some pretty good lines there.  It also relates to The Pillars, which is a Freeport I'm establishing. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/tab]]

[[tab GoI Formats]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[critter-profile-geist |Critter Profile: Geist!]]]
"//They say the cat would disappear during the day and come back at night. That in itself isn't especially peculiar for cats, but the mutilated animal parts that they found on their backyard the next morning sure were weird, said the father of the family.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This was kind of a last minute post for the last theme in JamCon 2020, "More Than Meets The Eye". Wrote it in about 2 hours, and had enough time to get crit from one person, but out of my JamCon posts I'm the proudest of this one.
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[critter-profile-clara |Critter Profile: Clara!]]]
"//You see, Clara is very fun-sized for a capybara. She's barely bigger than my fist! Her pups, all of whom seem to be asexually produced clones of herself, are merely the size of a thumb. Unfortunately, they don't grow any bigger than that, as they always die just a few weeks after birth from complications that we can't figure out the reason for.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This was the first thing I posted after 4 months of writer's block. It was originally supposed to be a cute and sweet story about tiny capybaras, but somehow it ended up being one of the darkest things I've ever written. Somehow. I'm happy with how it came out though. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]

+++ [[[the-eleven-fifty-nine | The Eleven Fifty-Nine]]]
"//A hunk of creaking silver whizzed past, dilapidated but unobstructed. The wheels made no noise, but the scream of the fog whistle grew louder even as the engine got further away, mixed in with the cries of the passengers.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
A collab with [[*user UncertaintyCrossing]]. It is our first, long awaited (by me) Parawatch article! And I've put it in the GoI tab on my author page because I do not agree with the categorization of Parawatch articles as tales, and this is my author page where I can do whatever the hell I want. 

This is based on an urban legend and inspired by a short story by Patricia C. McKissack. The idea was Crossings, and he wrote the first half, while I wrote the second. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/tab]]
[[tab Other]]
[[div style="float: center; border: solid 4px #BB0011; width: auto; padding: 1px 15px; margin: auto; margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:1em; box-shadow: 2px 1px 3px rgba(0,0,0,.2);"]]
+++ [[[what-lurks-below-sebarus-s-author-page |Author Page]]]
"//I write. With will as my quill and the fabric of reality as my canvas, I write, and my words shape reality.//"
[[collapsible show="+ Author Commentary" hide="- Author Commentary"]]
This is the page you're looking at right now, how trippy is that? It feels really surreal to finally have one on the site. Anyway, I decided to write the flavor text for this from the perspective of a skip, because why not. It's a little cringy, I admit, but who cares, it's just an author page. 
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]
[[/tab]]
[[tab Hall Of Fame]]
This is a space to showcase all of the cool things that people have made out of my stuff! I appreciate all of it, and I am greatly honored that people think that my writings are worthy of making more stuff out of, so it deserves to be showcased. If you have made something and it isn't here, it probably just means that I haven't seen it. In that case, if you want it up here, feel free to DM me on either Wikidot or Discord if we share a server.

[[=]]

[[tab Serious Shit]]
If life happens, and I either decide to leave the site, die, or otherwise don't show any activity for three years, without anyone knowing about my whereabouts, then I entrust [[*user UncertaintyCrossing]] with the ownership of all of my articles (aside from collaborations, which go to their respective co-authors), and all matters of deletion, porting and licensing are to be forwarded to him.
[[/tab]]
[[/tabview]]

------

[[=]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/=]]
author: Sebarus
